Description: Weft-faced plain weave and tapestry; a thick cloth of undyed wool, discoloured, with an oblong tapestry panel of purple wool and undyed linen bearing a geometric design set inside an elongated roundel; beaded border; sewn-up slit alongside the panel, double row of twining at top and bottom; purpose of slit unclear; plain weave: warp-undyed wool (S/c.9), weft-undyed wool (S/44-48); tapestry on single threads: warp-undyed wool (S/c.9), weft- purple wool (S/44-48); extra threads in linen (S spun Z ply); edges are torn or ragged, internal selvedges over two groups of warp threads; sewing at the closing slit in thick, undyed wool thread (S spun Z ply); purple wool is a mix of dark blue and dark red fibres
Curator's comments: Unreg.74; part of same textile as 72458, 72459 and 72415; similar to 72460 and 72464; previously in grey plan chest in Students' Room
